alert.note: Alert for Adams; Greeley; Hall; Howard; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 2:11PM CST until January 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...MORE SNOW ON THE WAY, FOLLOWED BY SEVERAL DAYS OF BITTER COLD... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected, along with blowing snow. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches, with the highest amounts expected to be near and north of Interstate 80. This snow will be accompanied by north winds gusting to around 35 MPH. For the Wind Chill Advisory tonight into Friday morning, wind chills around -20 to -25 are expected. For the Wind Chill Warning Friday evening through Tuesday morning, dangerously cold wind chills of at least -25 to -40 are expected. * WHERE...Greeley, Howard, Adams, Hall, and Webster Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread snow and blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and impact the Friday morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Winter Storm Warning, please note that some areas will see the onset of snow before others, and the majority of snow will actually occur this evening into tonight, then gradually end from west to east late tonight into Friday morning. Within any heavier snow bands, near-blizzard conditions with visibility reduced to around one-half mile are quite possible at times given the moderately-strong winds blowing around the relatively dry snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
